newsitem.title: GERMANY: Air cargo up 4.3pct in August at Frankfurt.
newsitem.headline: Air cargo up 4.3pct in August at Frankfurt.

text.p: Air cargo volumes at Frankfurt Airport showed unusually strong growth in August, the market research department of airport authority FAG said in its monthly report.
Tonnage handled at the country's leading air cargo gateway rose 4.3 percent to 110,154 tonnes compared to 12 months previously, it said.
Export volumes rose 6.4 percent in August and are now showing a 3.5 percent rise over the first eight months of the year, the report added.
Cargo growth at Frankfurt airport is now running at 1.9 percent plus for January-August, the report added.
Growth reflected improved foreign trade conditions for German exporters, the FAG experts said.

"The increasing rationalisation pressure from current price-dumping and over-capacity is leading to freighters being taken off some traffic routes and to a slightly stronger orientation of freight transport on to passenger services," the report noted.
Total freighter volumes rose 3.7 percent in August but belly cargo tonnage increased 4.9 perrcent, the report said. --Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 8982 Fax +44 171 542 5017
